meanings.definition: A class that is higher in the hierarchy than another class, from which it inherits attributes and methods.
meanings.sent1: In the coding world, superclasses are like the bosses of other classes.
meanings.sent2: The superclasses in this programming language are crucial for organizing the code.
meanings.sent3: When the superclass forgot its attributes at home, the other classes had to help out.
meanings.sent4: The superclass stood tall like a giant tree, providing shade and knowledge to the classes beneath.
meanings.sent5: The concept of superclasses is like a family tree, with each branch passing down traits to the next generation.

meanings.definition: The highest class in a class hierarchy.
meanings.sent1: Every class hierarchy has a special place reserved for the superclasses.
meanings.sent2: The superclasses at the top dictate the rules for all the other classes.
meanings.sent3: The superclasses threw a party at the summit of the class hierarchy.
meanings.sent4: The superclasses shone brightly like stars in the night sky of class structures.
meanings.sent5: The superclasses are like kings ruling over their loyal subjects in the class kingdom.
